definitions.definition: to flow over the edge of a container by accident; to make liquid do this

examples.text: Water had spilled out of the bucket onto the floor.
The bag split, and sugar spilled everywhere.
He opened the curtains, letting the morning light spill into the room.
He startled her and made her spill her drink.
Thousands of gallons of crude oil were spilled into the ocean.
I managed to carry three full glasses without spilling a drop.
I accidentally spilled my drink all over him.

definitions.definition: to come out of a place in large numbers and spread out

examples.text: The doors opened and people spilled into the street.
After the clubs closed, the drinkers spilled out into the streets.

definitions.definition: to waste time worrying about something that has happened that you cannot do anything about

examples.text: As the saying goes—**it's no use crying over spilt milk**.

definitions.definition: to tell somebody something that should be kept secret or private

examples.text: We don't want to spill the beans yet.
She made the mistake of spilling the tea on her sister's love life.
Nothing can justify spilling innocent blood.

definitions.definition: to tell somebody everything you know or feel about something, because you are upset

examples.text: He has spilled his guts in his new autobiography.

wordOrigin: verb Old English spillan ‘kill, destroy, waste, shed (blood)’; of unknown origin.
